#you have a java date with format "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX"

```{r}
#https://stackoverflow.com/questions/21667212/converting-datetime-string-to-posixct-date-time-format-in-r from this post
fixdate <- function(date){ 
  z <- as.POSIXct(date, usetz = TRUE, format="%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%OS")  #look at ?strptime for documentation %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S
z}
dhist1 <- dhist1 %>% mutate(createdxts = fixdate(created_at))
# yo remeber to use the fcn as.POSIXlt to convert to an time object where you can extract different parts
#helpful ref: 
```

```{r}
dhist1xts <- as.xts(as.matrix(dhist1), order.by= dhist1$createdxts)
```
